intro: Dasyloma benghalense, commonly known as the Bengal banyan, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters in height. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. It plays an important role in the ecosystems of its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
